definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Finally I introduced the process of applying for new bank in America.
sentences.chinese: 在本章的最后介绍了在美国申请新银行的发牌过程。

sentences.english: Deal cards one by one in a row from left to right, not overlapping.
sentences.chinese: 按从左至右的顺序发牌，并摆成一行，不要相互重叠。

sentences.english: Portions of this code will look like the simple Poker dealer built previously.
sentences.chinese: 这部分代码将类似先前构建的简单的扑克发牌器。

sentences.english: Beifa Brand Stationery is an International famous brand.
sentences.chinese: 贝发牌文具是国际著名的品牌。
我们抽牌来决定谁发牌吧。

sentences.english: You have to shuffle the cards before the cut for deal.
sentences.chinese: 你得先洗牌，然后再倒牌和发牌。

sentences.english: The dealer will provide five cards from the deck.
sentences.chinese: 发牌器将从整副牌中提供五张牌。

sentences.english: I wish you' d remember to shuffle before you deal.
sentences.chinese: 我希望在你发牌前记得洗牌。

sentences.english: That crooked dealer did me for $100 at poker.
sentences.chinese: 那个刁滑的发牌者在玩扑克牌时骗了我100美元。

sentences.english: The 'Supervisor' must be a suitably qualified special effects operator licensed or recognized by ESELA.
sentences.chinese: 必须是一位合资格及经发牌监督认可的特别效果技师。

sentences.english: The lotus officer started conveying a card again.
The other player, having picked the low card, deals first.
sentences.chinese: 另一名玩家，也就是拿到小牌的那位，首先发牌。

sentences.english: Take a pack of cards and deals the top 16 face down in four rows of four.
sentences.chinese: 拿一副纸牌，将顶上的16张面朝下分4排发牌。

sentences.english: This scheme had considerably improved the water quality in rivers within the New Territories.
sentences.chinese: 发牌计划大大改善了新界河流的水质。

sentences.english: The licensing by the finger when you can know what cards.
sentences.chinese: 发牌的时候用手指一摸就知道是什么牌了。

sentences.english: This machine is licensed for the road.
sentences.chinese: 这台机器上是发牌的道路。

definition: to bid (bridge and similar card games)
pai gow (gambling game played with dominoes)
